Saint Laurent Boulevard / [[Jean-Talon Street]][http://www.stm.info/English/metro/De_Castelnau.pdf Map] |}} '''De Castelnau''' is a station on the [[Line 5 Blue (Montreal Metro)|Blue Line]] of the [[Montreal Metro]] [[Rapid transit|rapid transit system]], operated by the [[SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al]] (STM). It is located in the [[Villeray]] district of the [[VillerayâSaint-MichelâParc-Extension]] borough of [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]].[http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m61.htm De Castelnau Metro Station] ==Overview== {{Expand section|date=April 2010}} It is a normal [[side platform]] station, built in tunnel with a central volume built in trench. Two entrances, one on each side of boul. Saint-Laurent, give access to a common ticket hall; one is integrated into an apartment building. The station is clad in [[travertine]], a reference to the Italian community in the area, and whimsical [[bas relief]]s by [[Jean-Charles Charuest]] depict scenes of the nearby [[MarchÃ© Jean-Talon]] ==Origin of name== Rue De Castelnau is named for French general [[NoÃ«l Ãdouard, vicomte de CuriÃ¨res de Castelnau]], who successfully defended the French town of [[Nancy, France|Nancy]] during [[World War I]]. ==Connecting bus routes== {{Main|SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al}} {{Main|List of Montreal Bus Routes}}
